content.p:
ยง 1399-vv. Studies and reports. The commissioner shall conduct a study
of exposure incidents occurring prior to and one year after the
effective date of regulations made under this article to determine the
effectiveness of the regulations in reducing sharps injuries and
exposure incidents, the level of compliance, and the need for any
modifications or revisions to the regulations. The results of the study
shall be reported to the governor and the legislature no later than six
months after the first twelve month period during which the regulations
have been effective. The commissioner shall submit a second report no
later than two years after the first report. The studies and reports
under this section shall be done in consultation with the technical
advisory committee established under this article.
